featured.text: The bank tries its best to attract more customers.
The islands soon attracted traders from different lands.
Deer are attracted to railway lines because of a need for iron in their diets.
Fireflies, small beetles that live in many warmer parts of the world, use light to attract a mate.
Dr. Chu’s speech on the new energy source attracted great _____ from the audience at the conference.

other.text: Due to the yearly bonus system, the 100 ________ positions in this high-tech company have attracted many applicants from around the island.
The industry leader, NBC, however, attracts 11 percent of viewers.
A combination of sound and visual devices attracts more deer to the tracks.
Why are deer attracted to train tracks?
Ruth is attracted… C.…when I met an old friend of mine.
With a continuous 3 km stretch of golden sand, the beach attracts artists around the world each summer to create amazing _____ with its fine soft sand.
Some even run regular activities to attract visitors.
PBS only attracts a minority of all TV viewers, about 2 percent.
One reason is that it’s easier for a company to attract new employees if it has a casual dress code.
They are attracted by the American writer’s 21 of the millennia-old glaciers.
They need those well-known ancient objects to attract people from all over the world.
They appear to be attracted to electromagnetic fields and attack electrical insulation or wire connections.

definition.en_def: To draw or pull towards oneself; to cause someone to have a liking for something.
definition.example: The bright colors of the flowers attract many bees.
